summary: Email chain regarding a planned visit by US Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other DOJ officials to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York to inspect the facility, specifically the areas related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death, including his cell. The correspondence coordinates logistics and discusses the involvement of law enforcement agents.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is organizing a visit to the MCC to inspect areas including Epstein's cell, the psych observation/suicide watch area, and the SHU.

persons.name: Ed O'Callahan
persons.context: DOJ official who will be joining the MCC visit along with Geoffrey Berman.

connections.description: Both are DOJ officials coordinating and participating in the same visit to the MCC.

events.title: MCC Visit Coordination
events.description: Email chain finalizing logistics for a visit by US Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other DOJ officials to the Metropolitan Correctional Center to inspect areas related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: US Attorney Geoffrey Berman planned a visit to the MCC to inspect the 2nd floor psych observation/suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Jeffrey Epstein's cell, which was noted as still being cordoned off.
The visit was to be escorted only by MCC legal staff, with instructions not to speak to any guards present due to ongoing investigations.
Additional law enforcement agents from the DOJ, including Ed O'Callahan, were joining the visit, though their exact number and identities were not fully known at the time of correspondence.
The request was made for the new acting warden to accompany the tour.
